Delivery is Monday, it's going to be maybe Thursday at your neighborhood. Prices are higher also. It's cheaper to shop elsewhere on nearly everything. Tilley replied to my queries. I followed the instructions provided by Tilley for the replacement guarantee, and Tilley is now sending me a new hat - All I had to do is pay the shipping costs. As light as sport model but classier and they stay clean for a very long time.

Bought this for a trip to Mexico, wore it all day every day. It was super comfortable...until it wasn't. I love that the belt is super stretchy and highly adjustable, never felt tight, and the back is flocked so I don't get sweaty. It sits flat so you can wear it under or over clothes, and holds a surprising amount. BUT THEN...24 hours before the end of the trip...a wire (seems to be plastic?) poked through the fabric and straight into my skin which was very uncomfortable. Trying to trim it only made it worse/more scrapy and poky. Yeah, I gave it some heavy use but it was only for a week and I'm very disappointed that it's disassembling itself so soon.

I'm hoping this is rare quality assurance failure because I really love this item and may buy another for my next trip and hope it lasts longer.

text: I brought this hat on a 7 day cruise to Mexico. I did a few physically demanding excursions and went the whole time without getting burnt on my face or neck, so I'd call it a good investment. Friends I was with relied on sunblock only and weren't as fortunate. Some may call it a "dad hat" but you just have to own it. The draw string will really come in handy if you are doing any boating or other activities where it will get a bit windy. I would say it is a bit more snug around the head than most hats that are labeled "L/XL", but not to the degree that it was uncomfortable for me.

product_title: Tilley Classic T3
product_category: Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry, Women, Accessories, Hats & Caps, Cowboy Hats
description: Rated UPF50+, Durable Water Repellent (DWR), Moisture-wicking hydrofil, Guaranteed for life, Made in Canada
text:
I hate to have to write this review. I really do. Here's why...

Tilley makes great hats. The finest outdoor hats in the whole world, bar none. I got my first Tilley 30 years ago and I've always loved everything about them. The style, the fit, the protection, and most of all, the fact that they never die. Well, they never die until they do, and that will happen after 20 years of hard wearing in the great outdoors. But that's ok! Tilley stand by their iconic lines with a lifetime, "Leave it in your Will" guarantee! And in 30 years and several hats, I have had to use that replacement guarantee once. One time.

I mention that because Tilley just makes awesome hats. So why should it matter if a hat has a different tag and won't be replaced if it takes too much abuse and can't be used anymore? If you get 15 years out of a $60 hat, didn't you get your money's worth? Yes. You did. You'll pay $150 for some sneakers that might last a couple of years or on a shirt that you'll wear for 3 seasons before you throw it away, so this hat will ABSOLUTELY give you your money's worth, even if it doesn't come with the age-old Tilley guarantee.

So why do I write this one-star review? Because this is sold as a hat with that guarantee, and it doesn't have it. The hat you're buying here simply isn't the hat that they're advertising. For a couple of years Tilley got rid of the guarantee, but they caved when those of us who had relied upon that guarantee said that we weren't interested. So Tilley relented and now offers the guarantee on select lines of hats. Victory!

The problem is that whoever is selling these hats on Amazon is using the titles from the Tilley website, and has even taken pictures from the Tilley website (including the models from a couple of seasons ago). They have taken those pictures from the lifetime guarantee hats and are using them to sell a different product. It's gross, it's disappointing, and it is a deliberate attempt to pull one over on customers.

Is this hat a nice hat? Sure. Will it last and last? Probably. But you won't know until you buy it and wear it long past the return date. And that's the problem. Buying here and getting (marginally) faster shipping isn't worth it. Wait until there's a sale on the Tilley site, take advantage of their free shipping, and wait for your genuine, guaranteed hat to arrive.

description: Wicks moisture for fast-dry comfort, Durable impact zones resist wear and protect the heel and toe, Radial arch support system engineered for secure fit, The everyday sock that can go anywhere, Premium ring spun cotton comfort,
text:
I bought these to go with low-top hiking shoes that are a tan color. I couldn’t find any socks in nude or cream that would go with the shoes, that had any reasonable level of thickness to them. Grey works fine.
They are long and that’s the only reason I deducted one star. You will have to wash & put them in the dryer before wearing.
They’re obviously designed to allow for shrinkage in a hot water wash and dryer. I wash in cold, dried on low.
I’ll update my review with how they wear over my 2-week hiking trip.
I would say, you get what you pay for and even though these are expensive, they’re the only low, grey socks that are almost 100% cotton and the appropriate thickness for hiking shoes that I could find ANYWHERE.
A mostly cotton sock, with a little spandex for shape retention, is getting extremely difficult to find. There’s so much cheap, Ch*n*se junk for sale, made out of synthetic materials that will cause your feet to sweat like crazy. Who would think that finding socks would be so hard?

review_title: Too tight, too hot, and too stupid
text:
I ordered the L/XL-according to sizing instructions-but it’s way too tight. I have a 23 inch head and my hat size is 7 3/8.

I’ve forced myself to wear it a few times, hoping it'll stretch or that I’ll get used to it, but it’s torture, and it looks stupid and frilly, like I'm wearing a daisy costume.

The stupidest part is that it doesn’t breathe at all! There are four “ventilation” holes, but the openings are tiny pinholes! Why even bother?!!

I have nothing good to say about it except it really helped illustrate how truly stupid a hat can be and what I need to avoid

review_title: Super comfortable even for those with somewhat flat feet!
text:
I have a very low, almost flat footed arch. Boots that don't hurt my feet can be a pain to find. I'm proud to say I've had these thorogoods going on 3 years and they have treated my feet awesome!

They had a pretty brief break in period, and the insoles fell apart near the end of year two (I'd say that's normal for any boot with a hard use) and I replaced with a workwear insole, but they are still going strong! I just keep conditioned with leather honey when they look a little dry.

The option to restore them and add a new sole via their website tells me they could last another 5 once these soles wear out.

I wouldnt hesitate to buy again although it might be a while unless I decide on a brown pair.

text:
These are great shoes and I've been wearing the Moab model for years. Super comfortable and always fit well.

One thing I have noticed over the years (and with several pairs of Moabs, not just one pair) is that they smell really bad. I use a boot dryer/sprays/etc. and they still stink. I'm not sure why, and it's not just a "me" issue. I have other pairs of work boots that smell, but the boot dryer helps with this. I'm not sure if it's just the materials the Moab is made of or what.

text: I ordered these in the longer length in dark grey and now the “shorter” Aka slightly cropped version in black. I do think they are a little pricy compared to other brands, but overall I do like them. They don’t feel cheap the fabric is thick and not see through at all. But not too thick that they feel heavy? If that makes sense. I ordered the small and am in early 2nd trimester. They fit true to size- I wouldn’t suggest sizing up at all. I got size small and I’m 5’5” ish and about 115-120#. There’s lots of room to grow in the belly / waist in there but not sagging down right now before I get a bigger belly. So that’s a plus. The ONLY negative is that I have a dog and the dog hair sticks like crazy to these. Unfortunate- the grey ones the hair doesn’t stick idk if it’s different material or what? But the black they cling to it. I love the pockets on the sides of these pants too. So handy. The pockets are up higher so if you’re wearing a longer shirt / sweater the tops of pockets might be cover so getting phone in/out is a *slight* inconvenience. But that’s a minor issue lol

review_title: A Hole-in-One for Style and Comfort!
text: The Libin Men’s 4-Way Stretch Golf Joggers are like finding a diamond in the rough – or in this case, the golf course. As someone with legs that are shorter than a putt on a mini-golf course and a build that’s more “stocky” than a bull market, finding pants that fit well is usually as elusive as a hole-in-one. But fear not, these pants not only hug my curves in all the right places but also allow me to move freely like a gazelle on the fairway. The only thing I wish for is a tailor who specializes in accommodating my “short leg stumps.” But hey, until then, I’ll just keep strutting my stuff in these pants and pretending I’m a pro golfer. 9/10, because let’s be honest, perfection is for the pros.

review_title: better than I expected! but not #3
text:
After reading the reviews I ended up ordering 3 sizes, just to hedge my bets. Turns out that my regular size was just fine. I washed and dried it inside out, hung it on a good hanger, and wore it the next day. It was not wrinkled at all, and lay well. It is butter soft and comfortable. I'm 5'5"/185lbs, and the XL is a great fit. I have since ordered the PERFECT earrings to match it, and am very pleased with the outfit. This would be a good choice for traveling, too. I have since ordered 2 other prints. LAC

PS update: I ordered the periwinkle blue background with the small white flowers, in the same size as my other 2. Without bothering to try it on, I washed and dried it, and then ironed out the shipping wrinkles. I wore it to church, and was very surprised by how very long it was. I spent the whole day hoisting it up so I would not trip! When I compared it to my other 2 (ordered in the same size) it was almost 3" longer! This is not the kind of fabric you can hand hem, so what can I do?! I've purchased earrings and a necklace to match it, and would like to keep it, but.........!? Help please!

product_category: Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry, Women, Shoes, Athletic, Running, Trail Running

features.Origin: Made in the USA or Imported

description: THIS WOMEN'S SHOE IS FOR: Trail Runners who want to explore and feel protected on changing terrain. This shoe is made to adapt quickly so runners stay comfortable and stable., SUPPORT IN ALL TERRAIN: Release grooves in the midsole allow for enhanced adaptability on rough terrain, while the Ballistic Rock Shield now includes vertical grooves to provide side-to-side adaptability. Updated construction allows the shoe to adapt, flex, and protect the foot in all terrains., CUSHION AND COMFORT: New DNA LOFT v2 Technology provides 10% softer and 20% lighter cushioning than previous models. New 2mm of foam in the midsole gives added comfort., ,
text: I have worn Brooks Ghosts for many years and wanted to get a pair of Brooks that would be more beefy for hiking with good support and grippy soles. These Cascadias sadly were not at all comfy like my Ghosts. They were the same size as my Ghosts but were much tighter over top of foot and then a bit lose in heel. They were also extraordinarily stiff and inflexible. I knew right away these were not going to work for me. Also the heel to toe drop is so much less than the ghosts and I felt very flat footed instead of having heel lifted which I love and am used to. They shoes were just overall very uncomfortable compared to Ghosts and I could not wait to get them the heck off my feet! I wish Brooks would make the ghosts into a hiking edition with a beefier sole and great gripping action with same awesome comfort. These were a fail. Sent back.

text: I've had 3 Dubliner Jackets over the years. The inner lining always wears out, it starts a year in and by 3 years of you wear anything you have white flakes everywhere! Hopefully the insulated jacket will solve this problem, by sealing it all inside. It fits just a little bit tighter than the jacket without the insulation. I hope it lasts for years to come. They have always been comfortable jackets in the past. Typically the jackets (Dubliner by H/H) closures have been velcro, but on this jacket there are snaps on both the cuffs and down the middle. I haven't decided if this is a positive or negative yet. The appearance of the jacket is nice and perfect for everyday wear for both casual and business. The hood tucks away nicely, but gives a really puffy neck, due to the insulation.

review_title: Best casual kitchen hat I've ever owned. Worth getting for outdoors too
text:
This is maybe the 2nd or 3rd review I've written, and I like it so much I felt compelled to...
I've worked in every type of restaurant, from giant resort kitchens with tons of air flow to small kitchens with broken hoods. I've worked places were after a day or so you will get a visible salt line on your hat from the sweat, but this hat fixed that. The mesh is open enough to let you cool off, but closed enough to keep hair and sweat from leaving. Even when I shaved my head for the summer, the inner band kept the sweat from dripping off my head. I'm not joking that I like this hat so much, I got a few for when I go hiking and fishing.

Looks good, feels good, fits good, and I wear one almost every day now.

product_title: Timex Men's Easy Reader Watch
product_category: Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry, Men, Watches, Wrist Watches
description: Silver-tone 18 millimeter stainless steel expansion band fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference, White easy-to-read dial with day & date window at 3 o'clock; Full Arabic numerals, Silver-tone 35 millimeter brass case with mineral glass crystal, Indiglo light-up watch dial, Water resistant to 30 meter (100 feet): In general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
text:
I've owned many day/date calender watches (many of them Timex) so this was a "no brainer" replacement for me.
It came without any instructions about set-up. I spent three days trying to figure out where the settings "stops" are on the pull-out stem. There was only one where there should have been three. it turns out that this "Timex" had only one "click" notch/stop for the stem but it needed three to control the settings. This watch has no "indents" for the fore & aft pull movements. In other words, It WOULD NOT CHANGE SETTINGS no matter how many spins I tried. This Timex "Keeps On Ticking" but doesn't DOESN'T "...take a licking." Infuriating and sad. "Poof!" There goes my old sense of Timex reliability. "Poof."

I like this belt. It’s a great belt and very durable, but, lately, the plastic buckle part that clips into the metal buckle holder hasn’t been staying together.

It’s like the plastic part separates to where it doesn’t fork out fully to hold in the buckle holder. So, every time I sit down or bend over the belt comes undone and I’m always having to re-attach it.

It fits great under all types of clothing, STAYS IN PLACE: Our high waist shaper shorts stays in place for all-day secure fit! Whether you’re recovering from postpartum, wearing them under a dress or relaxing at home. Our shapewear for women tummy control is lightweight and breathable,
text:
I normally wear a 2–3X, or a US size 20. I have had several Spanx Higher Power shorts in 1X over the years, and they fit perfectly.

Based on the size chart, I ordered a 3X—and could not get it up past my crotch. It was small enough that I’m not even going to bother sizing up—I don’t foresee a world where one size up (their biggest size) will fit me when the 3X was SO SMALL.

It’s so frustrating as a plus size woman to find products that *appear* to be inclusive, but are anything but.

I would estimate the 3X might fit someone who wears MAYBE a 14/16, depending on build.

I guess I’ll be sticking with my (more expensive) Spanx shorts for now. 🙃

Alas, excited to give it a try on the water.

review_title: A great jacket light but very warm
text: I've been wearing these Alpha jackets for over 40 years. I was wearing one when I met my wife 37 years ago. Since then I have owned 2 and I just bought a third. After several decades the original jacket started to tear in the orange liner. I replaced it with a new one. The second jacket is still perfect except I do a lot of mechanic work and I got it all oil stained. So I keep that one for my dirty work and I got a new one for when I want to look presentable. This jacket is perfect when you want light weight, durable, and warm. An added bonus is the classic military look of it. Young people go crazy for this jacket as I get remarks on it all the time. I leave very few amazon reviews, as I don't have much time, but for a product this good I make the time. You'll love it.

product_title: Tilley Classic T3
product_category: Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry, Women, Accessories, Hats & Caps, Cowboy Hats
description: Rated UPF50+, Durable Water Repellent (DWR), Moisture-wicking hydrofil, Guaranteed for life, Made in Canada
text:
I hate to have to write this review. I really do. Here's why...

Tilley makes great hats. The finest outdoor hats in the whole world, bar none. I got my first Tilley 30 years ago and I've always loved everything about them. The style, the fit, the protection, and most of all, the fact that they never die. Well, they never die until they do, and that will happen after 20 years of hard wearing in the great outdoors. But that's ok! Tilley stand by their iconic lines with a lifetime, "Leave it in your Will" guarantee! And in 30 years and several hats, I have had to use that replacement guarantee once. One time.

I mention that because Tilley just makes awesome hats. So why should it matter if a hat has a different tag and won't be replaced if it takes too much abuse and can't be used anymore? If you get 15 years out of a $60 hat, didn't you get your money's worth? Yes. You did. You'll pay $150 for some sneakers that might last a couple of years or on a shirt that you'll wear for 3 seasons before you throw it away, so this hat will ABSOLUTELY give you your money's worth, even if it doesn't come with the age-old Tilley guarantee.

So why do I write this one-star review? Because this is sold as a hat with that guarantee, and it doesn't have it. The hat you're buying here simply isn't the hat that they're advertising. For a couple of years Tilley got rid of the guarantee, but they caved when those of us who had relied upon that guarantee said that we weren't interested. So Tilley relented and now offers the guarantee on select lines of hats. Victory!

The problem is that whoever is selling these hats on Amazon is using the titles from the Tilley website, and has even taken pictures from the Tilley website (including the models from a couple of seasons ago). They have taken those pictures from the lifetime guarantee hats and are using them to sell a different product. It's gross, it's disappointing, and it is a deliberate attempt to pull one over on customers.

Is this hat a nice hat? Sure. Will it last and last? Probably. But you won't know until you buy it and wear it long past the return date. And that's the problem. Buying here and getting (marginally) faster shipping isn't worth it. Wait until there's a sale on the Tilley site, take advantage of their free shipping, and wait for your genuine, guaranteed hat to arrive.

I've called the customer service number listed multiple times but hung up after more than a 10 minute wait each time. There's no other option to return.

This is my first and last time buying them from Amazon.
